author: Sam Barsanti
title: Newswire: Alex Trebek rapped Kanye West and Drake lyrics on Jeopardy! tonight
text:
(Photo: Getty Images, Bruce Bennett) (Photo: Getty Images, Bruce Bennett) Share Tweet 
The special Jeopardy! tournaments targeted toward younger peopleâ€”whether theyâ€™re kids or college studentsâ€”usually give the show a chance to let loose and throw in some fun pop culture-based categories about things kids like. Today, with the show in the middle of its collegiate tournament, Jeopardy! decided to dip into that crowd-pleaser well with a category called â€œLetâ€™s Rap Kids!â€ that required the contestants to name popular rap artists when given only the lyrics to one of their songs. Naturally, that meant host Alex Trebek had to recite some rap lyrics, which is always very funny. 
Pitchfork collected some video clips from the show that feature lines from Kanye Westâ€™s â€œFamous,â€ Desiignerâ€™s â€œPanda,â€ and Drakeâ€™s â€œStarted From The Bottom,â€ and you can see a few below: There's a rap category on Jeopardy, and Alex Trebek's got BARS. pic.twitter.com/W5NGCBREdf â€” Justin Ferguson (@JFergusonAU) February 21, 2017 Here's Alex Trebek rapping on @Jeopardy for those of you not watching ğŸ˜‚ pic.twitter.com/FANczhVSl7
